refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The BonoboControlFrame object is used to embed a Control. Most people will want to use BonoboWidget instead of the control frame since it provides lots of nice auxiliary features to make embedding easy.

The control frame is coupled to an embedded control and is used to allow the Control to communicate with its environment, particuarly getting the BonoboUIContainer for merging its menu / toolbar UI elements.

refsect2.title: bonobo_control_frame_get_widget ()
refsect2.para: Use this function when you want to embed a BonoboControl into your container's widget hierarchy. Once you have bound the BonoboControlFrame to a remote BonoboControl, place the widget returned by bonobo_control_frame_get_widget() into your widget hierarchy and the control will appear in your application.

listitem.simpara: The BonoboControlFrame whose widget is being requested.a
A GtkWidget which has the remote BonoboControl physically inside it.

refsect2.title: bonobo_control_frame_set_ui_container ()
refsect2.para: Associates a new Bonobo_UIContainer object with this ControlFrame. This is only allowed while the Control is deactivated.

listitem.simpara: A Bonobo_UIContainer object reference.

refsect2.title: bonobo_control_frame_control_activate ()
refsect2.para: Activates the BonoboControl embedded in control_frame by calling the activate() Bonobo_Control interface method on it.

listitem.simpara: The BonoboControlFrame object whose control should be activated.

refsect2.title: bonobo_control_frame_control_deactivate ()
refsect2.para: Deactivates the BonoboControl embedded in frame by calling the activate() CORBA method on it with the parameter FALSE.

listitem.simpara: The BonoboControlFrame object whose control should be deactivated.

refsect2.title: bonobo_control_frame_set_autoactivate ()
refsect2.para: Modifies the autoactivate behavior of frame. If frame is set to autoactivate, then it will automatically send an "activate" message to the Control to which it is bound when it gets a focus-in event, and a "deactivate" message when it gets a focus-out event. Autoactivation is off by default.

listitem.simpara: A flag which indicates whether or not the ControlFrame should automatically perform activation on the Control to which it is bound.
A boolean which indicates whether or not frame is set to automatically activate its Control. See bonobo_control_frame_set_autoactivate().

refsect2.title: bonobo_control_frame_get_control_property_bag ()
refsect2.para: This retrives a Bonobo_PropertyBag reference from its associated Bonobo Control

listitem.simpara: CORBA property bag reference or CORBA_OBJECT_NIL

refsect2.title: bonobo_control_frame_set_propbag ()
refsect2.para: Makes frame use propbag for its ambient properties. When frame's Control requests the ambient properties, it will get them from propbag.

listitem.simpara: A BonoboPropertyBag which will hold frame's ambient properties.
The BonoboPropertyBag object which has been associated with frame.

refsect2.title: bonobo_control_frame_control_set_state ()
refsect2.para: Proxies state to the control bound to frame.

listitem.simpara: A GtkStateType value, specifying the widget state to apply to the remote control.

refsect2.title: bonobo_control_frame_set_autostate ()
refsect2.para: Changes whether or not frame automatically proxies state changes to its associated control. The default mode is for the control frame to autopropagate.

listitem.simpara: Whether or not GtkWidget state changes should be automatically propagated down to the Control.
Whether or not this control frame will automatically proxy GtkState changes to its associated Control.
